Text: Delta was tracking John Smith, but she's gone dark.
—Delta?!

We found signs of an intense battle... And it seems
during the struggle...
...this came off.

Saying this, Gamma displays the tail ornament Delta
had been wearing.
*gasp*
I see... So Delta's been...

Upon realizing just how frail her own voice sounds,
Alpha takes a moment to compose herself.

She'd been prepared for this. Someone was always
going to fall, eventually. Today just happens to be
that day.

I can't imagine...her abandoning a mission you
assigned her.

That idiot! She might not have had much going on
upstairs, but she always did listen to you, Alpha!
Continue the search.
We have to find her, even if it's just a body...
Understood...

The Shadow Garden's missions are fraught with peril,
but because of Delta's combat prowess, she's always
the one being asked to handle the most dangerous
ones.

Her not coming back almost certainly means she's
dead...

No. 666 tried to tell her how dangerous John Smith was.
She shouldn't have sent Delta in alone.

Lady Alpha, the amount of counterfeits in circulation
is continuing to rise.

At this rate, the public will start questioning the
value of our bills, and soon we'll also face a bank
run at Mitsugoshi...

Unfortunately, our company lacks the necessary assets
to handle the expected bank run.

Urgent measures are required. We must take action to
eliminate this...John Smith...
That was his plan from the very beginning.
...What?!

He isn't some small-time crook trying to use
counterfeits to make a quick profit.

While Mitsugoshi and the MCA were preoccupied
with our trade war, he's been sowing his seeds in
the shadows.

He's deliberately triggering a credit collapse with
the intent of bankrupting both us and the MCA to
take everything from us.

So his true aim isn't just the profits generated by
the market, but the profit-generating mechanism
of the market itself!
What an...ambitious plan!
John...Smith...!

The Cult is very concerned about the current state of
affairs.

Should these unidentified counterfeit bills continue
circulating, it'll accelerate a credit collapse and
cause significant losses to the Cult.
Lord Gettan, this is not only your responsibility—

Gettan's blade flickers, and a streak of light races
to the throat of one of the Cult members.
The next moment, the man collapses.
Haaah...!
John Smith...was it?

Y-Yes... Every attempt to trace the source of the
counterfeit bills is thwarted by a man who calls
himself John Smith...
Garter.
Y-Yes, sir!

Set up checkpoints. Inspect all cargo coming in and
out of the capital.

Wha—? ...Huh? S-Sir, even for the likes of us, taking
such measures would cause an uproar in the kingdom...
The next moment, the other Cult member collapses.
Eeep...!

Find the source of the counterfeit bills at all
costs.
Ye...Yes, sir!
Have you heard? About the MCA...

The cargo hold issue? Both the Transport Minister and
the Knight Captain are livid.

They're finally showing their true colors. Humph.
We've been complacent because of the thriving
economy, but this is getting out of hand.
This...here...?
Alexia?
Hm?
Iris.

It's rare to see you back at the castle, even if it
is a holiday.

The academy is still under reconstruction, so I
figured the castle's library would be a better place
to find technical books.
What technical books?
Different kinds.
Law, engineering, economics, finance,
and also ancient languages...

Are you planning on laying down your sword and
becoming a scholar?
No.

It's to wield my sword where it truly matters.
I've been realizing a lot of things since the start
of spring.

Nothing will ever change if I just keep swinging my
sword blindly. I'll always just be an outsider...

If I want to wield my sword where it counts, I must
first earn my right to be there...

And there are ways to that path beyond just wielding
a sword. I've come to realize that.

Thanks to that, I feel like there's just not enough
time lately. Of course, I can't neglect my training
either—
Iris?
Alexia watches her sister as she quickly walks away.
